goal.tools.debugger

Interface DebugObserver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EclipseDebugObserver, LoggingObserver, TestConditionEvaluator

    public interface DebugObserver

    Observer of a SteppingDebugger. A debug observer receives debug events from the debuggers it is subscribed to, by callbacks to notifyBreakpointHit(DebugEvent). A default implementation is available in the abstract class MyDebugObserver.

    The owner or the class itself needs to SteppingDebugger#subscribe(DebugObserver) and SteppingDebugger#unsubscribe(DebugObserver) the observer with one or more debuggers. Also it needs to enable the events it wishes to observe, see SteppingDebugger#addPause(DebugObserver, Channel) and SteppingDebugger#subscribe(DebugObserver, Channel)

    Author:
    W.Pasman

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getObserverName()
      Returns the name of the debug observer.
      void notifyBreakpointHit(DebugEvent event)

    • Method Detail

      • getObserverName

        java.lang.String getObserverName()
        Returns the name of the debug observer. Must contain unique name, otherwise subscribe will throw exception.
        Returns:
        name of the debug observer.

      • notifyBreakpointHit

        void notifyBreakpointHit(DebugEvent event)

        Handles debug events received from the debugger. A debugger calls this method whenever a debug event that needs to be reported occurs.

        IMPORTANT: this method is called by the thread that is being debugged. The method should return immediately to not block the calling thread. For pausing or stepping the (agent) thread that is being debugged, the corresponding debugger methods should be used.

        Parameters:
        event - debug event received from debugger.
